segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're going to be bringing you the second part of our job interview series.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来求职面试系列的第二部分。

segments.en: That's right.
So this is an advanced lesson and we're going to be talking about educational background and experience.
segments.cn: 这是一个高级课程，我们将讨论教育背景和经验。

segments.en: Right.
So in the first part we saw preparing for a job interview.
segments.cn: 在第一部分中，我们讨论了准备求职面试。

segments.en: Now we are at the job interview and we're just going to be talking about your educational background and your job experience.
segments.cn: 现在我们在求职面试中，我们将讨论您的教育背景和工作经验。

segments.en: That's right.
And the language we're going to learn is going to focus mostly on these two areas.
segments.cn: 我们要学习的语言主要集中在这两个领域。

segments.en: Okay, perfect.
So let's take a look at some of the difficult words before we listen to the dialogue in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在听对话之前，让我们先看看一些难词。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
Alright, so we're going to talk about a few common words that have to do with education.
segments.cn: 好的，我们将讨论一些与教育相关的常见词汇。

segments.en: Now the first word, I think we might know this one, but there's a little trick to it.
segments.cn: 第一个词，我想我们可能知道这个，但有一点小技巧。

segments.en: So the first one is major.
Major.
Major.
So yeah, I guess everyone knows what a major is, right?
segments.cn: 所以是的，我想每个人都知道什么是专业，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, it's the main subject that you study in university.
segments.cn: 是的，它是您在大学学习的主要科目。

segments.en: Right, so you can study business as a major or... History.
segments.cn: 对，所以您可以选择商业作为专业或……历史。

segments.en: Exactly.
So, but you can also use it as a verb, right?
segments.cn: 但是您也可以用作动词，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
I majored in history.
Majored in.
So usually it's followed by the preposition in.
Yes, always.
In fact, when used as a verb, I majored in science.
segments.cn: 事实上，当用作动词时，我主修科学。

segments.en: I majored in business.
Yes.
Okay, so you can say my major is business, administration, or history, or you can say I majored in business.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以说我的专业是商业、管理或历史，或者你可以说我主修商业。

segments.en: Yeah, and the same pattern applies to minor.
segments.cn: 是的，同样的模式适用于辅修。

segments.en: Okay, so minor.
This is really interesting because this is more common in English-speaking countries, right?
segments.cn: 这真的很有趣，因为在英语国家更常见，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
So what exactly is a minor?
Well, just like your major, but smaller.
Okay, so if you major in history, maybe 60% of your classes are in history and you minor in French, maybe 30 or 40% of your classes are in French.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你主修历史，可能60%的课程是历史，而你辅修法语，可能30%或40%的课程是法语。

segments.en: So basically you can have two subjects in your degree.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你可以在你的学位中有两个科目。

segments.en: You can have a major in business with a minor in art.
segments.cn: 你可以主修商业，辅修艺术。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay, that's interesting.
All right, and another two simple words, a bachelor's degree.
segments.cn: 好吧，还有两个简单的词，本科学位。

segments.en: Bachelor's degree, okay.
A bachelor's degree is what you get after going to university for four years.
segments.cn: 本科学位是你在大学学习四年后获得的。

segments.en: Okay, so a bachelor's degree after four years, you get that.
segments.cn: 好的，所以四年后获得本科学位。

segments.en: Yeah, after that you get a master's degree.
segments.cn: 是的，之后你会获得硕士学位。

segments.en: Right, so that's another two years after your bachelor's degree.
segments.cn: 对，所以在本科学位之后再两年。

segments.en: Okay, and I guess a master's is more focused on an area, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我想硕士学位更专注于某个领域，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, more specialized.
More specialized.
And then the highest degree you can get is a PhD.
segments.cn: 然后你能获得的最高学位是博士学位。

segments.en: Exactly.
Which is a philosophy doctorate, right?
Uh-huh.
But you're not actually getting a degree in philosophy.
segments.cn: 但你实际上并不是获得哲学学位。

segments.en: No, it could be in international relations.
Okay, but this is really hard to get.
segments.cn: 好的，但这真的很难获得。

segments.en: You have to go to school for another five or six years, right?
segments.cn: 你必须再上五到六年的学。

segments.en: Yeah.
And it's a lot of research, and not many people have it.
segments.cn: 而且需要大量研究，并不是很多人拥有。

segments.en: Yeah.
Anyway, some simple words, but you know what?
segments.cn: 无论如何，一些简单的词，但你知道吗？

segments.en: It's quite unique to the English-speaking world, the system, so we thought we'd bring it to you now.
segments.cn: 这在英语国家的系统中相当独特，所以我们想现在带给你。

segments.en: Right, perfect.
So now let's listen to this guy who is at an interview, and he's going to be talking about his education and work experience.
segments.cn: 现在让我们听听这个在面试中的人，他将谈论他的教育和工作经验。

segments.en: Thanks for coming in today.
Did you have any trouble finding us?
Please take a seat.
Thank you.
So let's get started.
Tell me a bit about your educational background.
segments.cn: 请告诉我一些关于您的教育背景。

segments.en: Sure.
Well, I graduated with honors from Chesterton University with a major in business administration with a specialization in information management, and I minored in psychology.
segments.cn: 我从切斯特顿大学以优异的成绩毕业，主修商业管理，专攻信息管理，并辅修心理学。

segments.en: I chose this course of study for two reasons.
segments.cn: 我选择这个学习课程有两个原因。

segments.en: I wanted to gain some practical, marketable skills, which the information management track provided, and I also feel that the interpersonal skills are essential for professional success, hence the minor in psychology.
segments.cn: 我想获得一些实用的、可市场化的技能，而信息管理课程提供了这些技能，我也觉得人际交往能力对职业成功至关重要，因此辅修心理学。

segments.en: Interesting.
And your postgraduate studies?
Well, I am really passionate about consumer behavior, so I pursued a master's in that area.
segments.cn: 嗯，我对消费者行为非常热情，所以我在这个领域攻读硕士学位。

segments.en: I also strive to keep my professional skills current, so I continuously attend seminars and conferences related to management and customer service.
segments.cn: 我还努力保持我的专业技能与时俱进，因此我不断参加与管理和客户服务相关的研讨会和会议。

segments.en: Very good.
Now, tell me a little bit about your work experience.
segments.cn: 现在，请告诉我一些关于您的工作经验。

segments.en: I see here that you previously worked at Oracle.
Yeah, I worked as their customer support manager, which brought me a breadth of experience in both client care and process management.
segments.cn: 是的，我担任他们的客户支持经理，这让我在客户关怀和流程管理方面获得了丰富的经验。

segments.en: I supervised and coordinated the customer support team, as well as implemented new strategies to achieve better customer satisfaction.
segments.cn: 我监督和协调客户支持团队，并实施新策略以提高客户满意度。

segments.en: Interesting.
Yes, in this position, I was able to make some pretty significant contributions to the overall success of the company.
segments.cn: 是的，在这个职位上，我能够为公司的整体成功做出一些相当重要的贡献。

segments.en: With the different initiatives that we implemented, we lowered our churn rate to about 5%, which had a direct impact on revenue.
segments.cn: 通过我们实施的不同举措，我们将客户流失率降低到约5%，这对收入产生了直接影响。

segments.en: Well, those were some pretty good answers to those questions, but I don't know, Marco.
segments.cn: 嗯，这些问题的回答相当不错，但我不知道，Marco。

segments.en: There was a little awkward moment, I don't know if you guys heard it, natural body functions.
segments.cn: 有一点尴尬的时刻，我不知道你们是否听到了，自然的身体功能。

segments.en: Well, making the interview a little bit more interesting, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，让面试变得更有趣，对吧？

segments.en: It doesn't have to be boring.
Exactly.
But what is really interesting is some of the language he used to describe his educational background and work experience.
segments.cn: 但真正有趣的是他用来描述自己教育背景和工作经验的一些语言。

segments.en: So let's look at that now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在语言收获中看看。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
Okay, so in language takeaway today, we have seven words that we want to focus on.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在今天的语言收获中，我们有七个词要关注。

segments.en: Before we give you some tips about doing well on a job interview.
segments.cn: 在我们给你一些关于如何在面试中表现良好的建议之前。

segments.en: So let's take a look at the first word, course of study.
segments.cn: 让我们先看看第一个词，学习课程。

segments.en: Course of study.
Course of study.
A course of study.
So what is a course of study exactly?
segments.cn: 那么，学习课程到底是什么呢？

segments.en: Basically, it's like a plan of study or a path of study.
segments.cn: 基本上，它就像是一个学习计划或学习路径。

segments.en: Okay, so his course of study was... Business administration.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他的学习课程是……商业管理。

segments.en: Exactly.
So that is his course of study.
segments.cn: 所以这就是他的学习课程。

segments.en: Now let's take a look at our second word, track.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看第二个词，轨道。

segments.en: Track.
Track.
So he said he wanted to gain some practical, markable skills that the information management track provided.
segments.cn: 所以他说他想获得一些信息管理轨道提供的实用、可标记的技能。

segments.en: So what does he mean by this track?
segments.cn: 那么他所说的这个轨道是什么意思呢？

segments.en: Again, basically the track of study is like the path of study.
segments.cn: 再次，基本上学习轨道就像学习路径。

segments.en: Okay.
So the direction of your study.
Okay.
So I guess it would be like think of a train and the train tracks, right?
segments.cn: 我想这就像想象一列火车和火车轨道，对吧？

segments.en: Where the train travels.
So that's where it's taking you.
segments.cn: 所以这就是它带你去的地方。

segments.en: That's the path that he followed or you should follow or you want to follow.
segments.cn: 这是他所遵循的路径，或者你应该遵循的，或者你想要遵循的。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay.
That's pretty interesting.
Now let's take a look at our third word and it's a really nice conjunction.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看第三个词，这是一个非常好的连词。

segments.en: Hence.
Hence.
H -e-n-c-e.
Hence.
Hence.
So it sounds fancy, but yes.
What does it mean?
So.
Therefore.
Right.
So you can use it as a conjunction between two ideas.
segments.cn: 所以你可以把它用作两个想法之间的连词。

segments.en: So he said, what would be an example of how you could use hence?
segments.cn: 所以他说，如何使用因此的例子是什么？

segments.en: You could say the economy is doing poorly.
segments.cn: 你可以说经济表现不佳。

segments.en: Hence people are losing their jobs.
Okay.
Hence.
So therefore in consequence.
Right.
Exactly.
But it just sounds a lot more like professional.
Informal.
Formal.
Yeah.
Okay.
So try and use this conjunction hence, right?
segments.cn: 所以尝试使用这个连词因此，对吧？

segments.en: Instead of saying so therefore?
Yep.
Use it.
Okay.
Our fourth word.
Pursued.
Pursued.
He pursued a master's.
segments.cn: 他追求了一个硕士学位。

segments.en: Okay.
So to pursue.
To chase after something.
To chase after.
So you can pursue a master's degree like he did.
segments.cn: 所以你可以像他一样追求硕士学位。

segments.en: Yes.
You can pursue a promotion.
A dream.
Nice one.
Can you pursue a girl?
segments.cn: 你可以追求一个女孩吗？

segments.en: Yes, you can.
All right.
So pursue to chase.
Yes.
Okay.
Now let's look at our next word.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: Strive.
Another great word you can use when talking about your experience.
segments.cn: 另一个很好的词，你可以在谈论你的经历时使用。

segments.en: To strive is to try really hard.
segments.cn: 努力就是非常努力地尝试。

segments.en: To try really hard.
Okay.
So I know we have some examples for strive.
segments.cn: 我知道我们有一些关于努力的例子。

segments.en: Yeah.
Let's take a listen.
Example one.
At our company, we are always striving to improve our services.
segments.cn: 在我们公司，我们总是努力改善我们的服务。

segments.en: Example two.
He really strived to get a new job and his work paid off.
segments.cn: 他真的努力找到了新工作，他的努力得到了回报。

segments.en: Okay.
Great examples of strive to fight, to try really hard.
segments.cn: 努力的很好的例子，努力，努力尝试。

segments.en: All right.
Okay.
Now the next word, I didn't really know what it meant.
segments.cn: 现在下一个词，我真的不知道它的意思。

segments.en: So this is really interesting.
Breadth.
Breadth.
So it's kind of like saying bread, but adding a th at the end.
segments.cn: 所以这有点像说面包，但在末尾加上th。

segments.en: Breadth.
Breadth of experience.
Okay.
So this basically means it's wide.
segments.cn: 所以这基本上意味着它很宽。

segments.en: Exactly.
So when you have a great breadth of experience, you have a wide variety of experience.
segments.cn: 所以当你有丰富的经验时，你有各种各样的经验。

segments.en: Okay.
So maybe in different fields or in different jobs.
segments.cn: 所以可能是在不同的领域或不同的工作中。

segments.en: So you can have experience like in marketing and in a little bit in finance and a little bit in management.
segments.cn: 所以你可以在市场营销方面有经验，在财务和管理方面也有一点。

segments.en: Yes.
A breadth of experience.
All right.
All right.
And now for the last word, it's actually three in one.
segments.cn: 现在最后一个词，实际上是三个合一。

segments.en: A three in one deal.
A three in one deal.
That actually they are very related.
segments.cn: 这实际上是非常相关的。

segments.en: Okay.
Right.
So when he talked about his work experience, he was saying he supervised and coordinated the customer support team.
segments.cn: 所以当他谈到他的工作经验时，他说他监督和协调客户支持团队。

segments.en: Okay.
So he watched over, right?
And made things work together well.
To coordinate.
Yes.
So these are really great verbs that you can use when you're talking about your job responsibilities.
segments.cn: 所以这些都是你在谈论工作职责时可以使用的很好的动词。

segments.en: I supervised.
I coordinated.
And here's another really great one that said to implement.
segments.cn: 还有另一个很好的动词是“实施”。

segments.en: To implement.
To make something happen.
To put it in place.
Right.
So he implemented new strategies.
segments.cn: 所以他实施了新的策略。

segments.en: Implemented new policies.
Okay.
To set in action.
Exactly.
All right.
So a lot of great vocabulary.
segments.cn: 所以有很多很好的词汇。

segments.en: A lot of great stuff.
And well, you can use it for when you are at a job interview.
segments.cn: 而且，你可以在面试时使用这些。

segments.en: So let's listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以让我们再听一遍这个对话。

segments.en: And when we come back, we're going to give you some tips.
segments.cn: 当我们回来时，我们将给你一些建议。

segments.en: So you'll do well in this part of the job interview.
segments.cn: 这样你在面试的这一部分会表现得很好。

segments.en: Thanks for coming in today.
Did you have any trouble finding us?
Please take a seat.
Thank you.
So let's get started.
Tell me a bit about your educational background.
segments.cn: 请告诉我一些关于你的教育背景。

segments.en: Sure.
Well, I graduated with honors from Chesterton University with a major in business administration with a specialization in information management.
segments.cn: 我从切斯特顿大学以优异的成绩毕业，主修商业管理，专攻信息管理。

segments.en: And I minored in psychology.
I chose this course of study for two reasons.
segments.cn: 我选择这个学习方向有两个原因。

segments.en: I wanted to gain some practical, marketable skills, which the information management track provided.
segments.cn: 我想获得一些实用的、可市场化的技能，而信息管理课程提供了这些。

segments.en: And I also feel that the interpersonal skills are essential for professional success.
segments.cn: 我也觉得人际交往技能对职业成功至关重要。

segments.en: Hence the minor in psychology.
segments.cn: 因此选择了心理学作为辅修。

segments.en: Interesting.
And your postgraduate studies?
Well, I am really passionate about consumer behavior.
segments.cn: 我对消费者行为非常热情。

segments.en: So I pursued a master's in that area.
segments.cn: 所以我在这个领域攻读硕士学位。

segments.en: I also strive to keep my professional skills current.
segments.cn: 我还努力保持我的专业技能与时俱进。

segments.en: So I continuously attend seminars and conferences related to management and customer service.
segments.cn: 所以我不断参加与管理和客户服务相关的研讨会和会议。

segments.en: Very good.
Now, tell me a little bit about your work experience.
segments.cn: 现在，请告诉我一些关于你的工作经验。

segments.en: I see here that you previously worked at Oracle.
segments.cn: 我看到你之前在甲骨文工作。

segments.en: Yeah, I worked as their customer support manager, which brought me a breadth of experience in both client care and process management.
segments.cn: 是的，我担任他们的客户支持经理，这让我在客户关怀和流程管理方面获得了广泛的经验。

segments.en: I supervised and coordinated the customer support team, as well as implemented new strategies to achieve better customer satisfaction.
segments.cn: 我监督和协调客户支持团队，并实施新的策略以提高客户满意度。

segments.en: Interesting.
Yes, in this position, I was able to make some pretty significant contributions to the overall success of the company.
segments.cn: 是的，在这个职位上，我能够为公司的整体成功做出一些相当重要的贡献。

segments.en: With the different initiatives that we implemented, we lowered our churn rate to about 5%, which had a direct impact on revenue.
segments.cn: 通过我们实施的不同举措，我们将客户流失率降低到约5%，这对收入产生了直接影响。

segments.en: All right, well, I want to talk about two main things.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想谈两件主要的事情。

segments.en: And the first thing I want to talk about is how you address this question about your educational background.
segments.cn: 我想谈的第一件事是你如何回答关于你教育背景的问题。

segments.en: Like, what is the interviewer looking to find out?
Okay, perfect.
So when you are talking about your educational background, you shouldn't only talk about your college degree, right?
segments.cn: 所以当你谈论你的教育背景时，你不应该只谈论你的大学学位，对吧？

segments.en: Yep.
You should also talk about any type of training that you've had.
segments.cn: 你还应该谈论你所接受的任何培训。

segments.en: Yeah, I think it's really important to let the interviewer know that you're continually trying to update your skills and improve your knowledge.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为让面试官知道你在不断更新技能和提高知识是非常重要的。

segments.en: So any sort of courses or seminars that you might attend, this is a great chance to highlight those.
segments.cn: 所以你可能参加的任何课程或研讨会，都是一个很好的机会来突出这些。

segments.en: And that's what the interview is looking for, right?
segments.cn: 这正是面试所关注的，对吧？

segments.en: Also, any trade publications, any magazines that you read related to your job is a great way to sort of highlight your desire to keep learning.
segments.cn: 另外，任何与你的工作相关的行业出版物、杂志，都是突出你渴望不断学习的好方法。

segments.en: Well, I think that's really important because it's good that you went to a good university, you got this degree and everything, but continuously training yourself and maybe just by listening to business podcasts or reading specific magazines or stuff like that,
segments.cn: 嗯，我认为这非常重要，因为你去了一所好大学，获得了这个学位，但不断培训自己，可能只是通过听商业播客或阅读特定的杂志或类似的东西，

segments.en: that is demonstrating that you care about what you do and that you are continuously learning, right?
segments.cn: 这表明你关心你所做的事情，并且你在不断学习，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, so those are the main things to talk about in your educational background.
segments.cn: 好的，这些是谈论你教育背景的主要内容。

segments.en: Now, when this work experience question pops up, what should you really say?
segments.cn: 现在，当工作经验的问题出现时，你应该说些什么？

segments.en: When you're answering this question, I think there's something really important to keep in mind.
segments.cn: 当你回答这个问题时，我认为有一些非常重要的事情需要记住。

segments.en: What's that?
You want to make sure that you're being as specific as possible, right?
segments.cn: 你要确保尽可能具体，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so giving examples of what you've done.
segments.cn: 对，所以要给出你所做的事情的例子。

segments.en: Like really specifically what you did, all of the sort of the main achievements you have.
segments.cn: 具体来说你做了什么，所有主要成就。

segments.en: Okay, so like for example, we saw in our dialogue that he talked about specific strategies that he implemented to improve customer support in that company.
segments.cn: 好的，比如说，我们在对话中看到他谈到了他实施的具体策略，以改善该公司的客户支持。

segments.en: Right, and then he gave some numbers.
segments.cn: 对，然后他给出了一些数字。

segments.en: Right, he said he lowered the churn rate to about 5%.
segments.cn: 对，他说他将流失率降低到约5%。

segments.en: So it's so important whenever you can attach a number to your success or your achievement, to be able to do that in the interview really demonstrates your achievement.
segments.cn: 所以每当你能将数字与成功或成就联系起来时，在面试中能够做到这一点真的能展示你的成就。

segments.en: Yeah, I think that's really important.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为这非常重要。

segments.en: And another thing when you're talking about previous jobs is make sure you keep it on a positive note.
segments.cn: 还有一点，当你谈论之前的工作时，确保保持积极的语气。

segments.en: Even if your experience was not very good or you didn't like the company or you know you had problems, you should avoid talking about that and always keep it on a positive note.
segments.cn: 即使你的经历不是很好，或者你不喜欢那家公司，或者你知道你遇到了问题，你也应该避免谈论这些，总是保持积极的语气。

segments.en: Right, so if the interviewer asks you why you want to join this company, why you're looking to leave your current job, you want to give these positive reasons.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果面试官问你为什么想加入这家公司，为什么想离开你现在的工作，你要给出这些积极的理由。

segments.en: Right, you don't want to say well because my boss was a jerk or I didn't like the company anymore.
segments.cn: 对，你不想说因为我的老板是个混蛋，或者我不再喜欢这家公司。

segments.en: You know, you should answer it with something positive like well I think I need a change or this job opportunity is more aligned with what I want to do in the future, etc.
segments.cn: 你知道，你应该用一些积极的方式回答，比如我觉得我需要改变，或者这个工作机会更符合我未来想做的事情，等等。

segments.en: Yeah, so positive always on your interviews and just again prepare for these questions that are always going to be there.
segments.cn: 是的，所以在面试中总是保持积极，再次准备好这些总会出现的问题。

segments.en: So Erica, I know that you've done a lot of interviews and I understand that you've had a really weird question.
segments.cn: 所以，Erica，我知道你做了很多面试，我理解你遇到过一个很奇怪的问题。

segments.en: Yes, in an interview I once got this question.
segments.cn: 是的，在一次面试中我曾被问到这个问题。

segments.en: If you were a tree, what kind of tree would you be?
segments.cn: 如果你是一棵树，你会是什么树？

segments.en: Really?
Yeah, I'm not kidding.
I really was asked that question.
segments.cn: 我真的被问过这个问题。

segments.en: What did you answer?
I think I said that I would want to be a Willow tree because they're really beautiful.
segments.cn: 我想我说我想成为一棵柳树，因为它们真的很美。

segments.en: Was that the right answer?
I don't know, like what are you supposed to answer to that question?
segments.cn: 我不知道，你应该怎么回答这个问题？

segments.en: I really don't know what the right answer was.
segments.cn: 我真的不知道正确答案是什么。

segments.en: Well some people, yeah, they'll ask you just, I don't know, random questions just to see what your response is.
segments.cn: 嗯，有些人，他们会问你一些，我不知道，随机的问题，只是想看看你的反应。

segments.en: I think also maybe it's just how you deal with the pressure.
segments.cn: 我觉得也许这只是你如何应对压力。

segments.en: Or with the unexpected questions.
Right, so it's like that is pretty unexpected though.
segments.cn: 对，所以这确实是相当意外的。

segments.en: But I guess you handle it pretty well.
Okay, well I mean I got the job.
segments.cn: 好吧，我是说我得到了这份工作。

segments.en: Oh nice, all right.
All right, I want to know from our listeners, if they were a tree, what kind of tree they would be?
segments.cn: 好吧，我想知道我们的听众，如果他们是一棵树，他们会是什么树？

segments.en: Yeah, and also tell us about, well, your job experience or your educational background.
segments.cn: 是的，还有告诉我们，嗯，你的工作经历或教育背景。

segments.en: Well I know for example that I've had a lot of different types of jobs.
segments.cn: 我知道，比如说，我有很多不同类型的工作。

segments.en: I've even been that person that gets on the bus and charges people the money.
segments.cn: 我甚至曾经是那个上公交车向人收费的人。

segments.en: I know, like you've had every job under the sun.
segments.cn: 我知道，你的工作经历真是五花八门。

segments.en: But it's great.
So tell us, what's the weirdest job you've had?
segments.cn: 那么告诉我们，你做过的最奇怪的工作是什么？

segments.en: What's the craziest or the best job?
segments.cn: 最疯狂或最好的工作是什么？

segments.en: Or any experiences?
Yes, so visit our website EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 是的，请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Leave your questions and comments there on the website.
segments.cn: 在网站上留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: And we'll definitely be there to answer them.
segments.cn: 我们一定会在那里回答它们。

segments.en: And we hope to see you there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你。

segments.en: Thanks for listening and goodbye.
